Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle, decorated on the discus with a nymph and a satyr. Within the base-ring is an impressed letter T. Buff clay, covered with a dark brown slip. Surface eroded.
Curator's comments: A label, now removed, indicates Egypt as the find-place: 'Oil lamp unused (for the Ka)'.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1890)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
